headline: The Trade Desk Slumps 68% in the Past Year: How to Approach the Stock?
summary: TTD is down 68% in a year, but CTV momentum, open-internet strategy, AI-driven Kokai and a $1.4B cash pile fuel a 2026 rebound debate.

headline: Can Trade Desk's OpenAds Make Media Supply Chains Healthier?
summary: TTD gains early publisher backing for OpenAds, a new transparent auction model aimed at improving trust, signals and efficiency in programmatic advertising.

headline: Jim Cramer Says “The Trade Desk Still Needs to Figure Out Where It Fits in the World”
summary: The Trade Desk, Inc. (NASDAQ:TTD) is one of the S&P 500 and Nasdaq-100 stocks Jim Cramer commented on. Cramer highlighted that the stock had a “brutal year,” as he stated: “Now, who’s on the losing side of the ledger? Actually, some very famous companies that we used to talk about all the time. headline: 1 Stock Under $50 Worth Your Attention and 2 That Underwhelm
summary: Stocks trading between $10 and $50 can be particularly interesting as they frequently represent businesses that have survived their early challenges. However, investors should remain vigilant as some may still have unproven business models, leaving them vulnerable to the ebbs and flows of the broader market.

headline: What Catalysts Are Quietly Shifting The Trade Desk (TTD) Narrative Now?
summary: What Changed in the Price Target Model? The slight trim in fair value from about US$62.33 to US$61.12 per share mainly reflects analysts rebalancing expectations after a period of richer pricing for the stock, rather than reacting to any single data point. While the discount rate stays around 6.96%, assumptions for revenue growth in the model move gently higher to about 15.95%, supported by commentary around AI driven products such as Kokai, product catalysts, and a backdrop where ad demand...

headline: Is Trade Desk (TTD) Pricing Look Misaligned After 68% One-Year Share Price Slump?
summary: If you are wondering whether Trade Desk is attractively priced or if you are paying up for the story, this article walks through what the current share price might be implying about its value. The stock last closed at US$38.65, with returns of 1.8% over 7 days, a 1.8% decline over 30 days, a 2.6% gain year to date, and a 68.2% decline over the past year. These changes can influence how investors think about both opportunity and risk. These moves sit against a backdrop of ongoing interest in...
